task_summary: The robot is tasked with swiping a spherical white ball object across a blue surface using its tool, as visually confirmed in the provided frames.

task_long_description.overview: The episode depicts a robotic arm equipped with a flat tool positioned above a small white ball on a blue surface. The robot first localizes the ball, approaches from above, and aligns. It proceeds to execute a swipe (push) action, propelling the ball with the tool in a specific direction (across the surface). After completing the swipe, the robot retreats its end-effector from the interaction area. No grasping or pick-and-place is performed; only a planar push/swipe.
preconditions: Ball object is present and visible on the blue surface.
The robot tool is within workspace reachable of the ball.
stepwise_plan: Move tool above the ball to a safe offset.
Approach and align with the ball's center.
Push (swipe) the ball along the surface with the tool for a set distance.
Retreat the tool from the ball's vicinity.
success_criteria: Ball is clearly translated from its initial to a new location along the push direction.
No grasp or pick action occurs.
failure_and_recovery: If ball is not detected: reattempt detection.
If push results in missed contact: retry push.
If unexpected movement occurs: abort and retreat.
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates after completing the swipe and retreat actions.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detects the ball on the workspace using vision.
Moves the tool above the ball at a safe Z height.
Aligns tool precisely with the centerline of the ball.
Executes the push/swipe action, moving the ball across the surface.
Retracts end-effector from ball after push.

failure_modes: Missed ball during approach or push
recovery_strategy: Abort and retreat if unexpected object encountered
assumptions: Instruction 'swipe' was interpreted via visual evidenceâ€”which strongly pointed to a push action with the tool against a spherical object; no indication of grasp or pick.
Direction_deg=180 selected from visual push appearance; 'ball' used as symbolic object id.
The dataset frames showed no overt grasp or rotation, so simpler push schema applied.

expected_success_criteria: Ball's final position is displaced along the push direction after tool contact.
test_scenarios: grasp_fail (not applicable here, as no grasp)
